intro: Cyphomandra argentea, commonly known as silver potato or silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has hairy, silver-green leaves that give it its common name. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to red as they mature. While not typically cultivated for food, it has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
